reviews.review: It's a great game to play if you want to have a fun night with friends! The only thing I would like is for there to be more customization options.

After BHVR decided to add a win condition to an asymmetrical game to measure the MMR system, the quality of gameplay has decreased significantly.

If you're playing survivor, you'll be considered a winner if you escape the trial; it seems simple right? But it isn't like that; escaping the trial might sometimes have nothing to do with how you played, but how maybe one or two of your teammates has dealt with the killer.

Likewise, as a killer, you'll be considered a victorious one if you kill three survivors (no need to kill all 4), and if you manage to do that, you'll allegedly be playing against better survivors. Which isn't always true.

It has changed significantly how people played the game, and the old grade system is actually a better indicator of skill than whatever this new MMR is.

While this is happening, I wouldn't advise new players in.

This is basically hide and seek, apart from the killers have seemingly endless perks which allow them to see exactly where you are hiding, so it's just a game of fetch for the killer. Wow, fun.

It's terrible. When any of the many OP killer perks aren't ruining every game, It's basically purely down to luck; if you happen to be on a decent team, if the killer happens to not be one of the many massively over powered characters in the game you might get a decent match, otherwise, be prepared for endless frustrations.

UPDATE: Having since played about another 50 hours I rate this game even worse now. The new killer is ridiculously OP, that weird gimpy passive chain thing is just annoying and zero fun to deal with - the insta-spawn when trying to remove the chains is ludicrous. This might now be the least fun game of all time.

It's sad, the game now filled with camping and tunneling killers even at high ranking match.

I will alter the review again later when they found out how to "effectively penalize" camper and tunneler. What I mean by that is just implement some sort of "extreme reduction to point rewards" for such action. For a game that rewards sportsmanship acts, there should be penalty for unsportsmanship acts. 

Because there are literally killers character that can "1 hit down" any survivor, and they are being used for camping/tunneling and it's just not fair.

There should also be some sort of compensation for survivor that got camped/tunneled as well.

Cheaters and Hackers are welcome - you get protected by the Devs and Supps just like in Warzone.

There are many Hackers, speed for example. The known ingame report Function doesnt do anything like in other games unless the Human being is so dumb to do it like 50 times in a row. That will not happen.

In Order to report a Hacker now, u write to the Support with all the Information you was able to get.
Only to get told that you need a VIDEO PROOF.

Well Video proof, nice idea. If there would be a built in Possibilty to get one.
There is no Chance for you to get that, unless you were smart? enough to record EVERY SINGLE GAME with a third party! software. Then you can cut your video for them, and send it to them with all other information.
Needless to say that no one, or maybe 1 % of the gamers will do that.
Also you need a PC that is able to do that and the Storage to record every game.

If it would be like in CSGO or riot with league, no problem i give you the video proof. But not like this.

Nice nice. 

Can not recommend if you want a nice cheat free game experience.
this game lets me take out my frustrations by murdering internet people

Das Spiel macht SpaÃŸ, ist abwechslungsreich, bekommt immer noch neue Updates (die auch gut sind)-
Etwas unlucky ist es, dass man als survivor nicht gut (eig. gar nicht) mit seinen Mates kommunizieren kann was das solo queuen echt blÃ¶d macht. Als Killer muss man ja solo spielen, auÃŸer man spielt mit Freunden (zu 5.) in einer selbst erstellten Lobby.
Am Anfang war ich relativ lange Ã¼berfordert mich bei den Perks einzufuchsen, weil es dann doch viele Charaktere und Perks gibt, die man nutzen kann und es dadurch dauert bis du die alle im Kopf hast (gerade bei den Killern).
Also falls wer Ã¼berlegt sich das Game zu holen fragt nh Freund oder so ob er/sie Bock hat das mit euch zu spielen und seid bereit etwas Zeit zu investieren bis ihr die Perks kennt, dann macht das Game so richtig fun :).
